title: People should stop saying the Devs dont communicate with us if.....
body:
They dont even check the Dev Corner page. Meddler among others post and respond here quite frequently. Its literally an entire section dedicated to keeping people up to date with potential changes and feedback. Go check it out before saying Riot ignores us. 

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner

replies.body:
Yeah I think that's where the devs are mostly active at; they've mentioned this many many times. If you are upset and you highly want to get some insightful answers, your best bet is coming over there to reason in a respectable environment, not in this ghetto gameplay. 

It's gotten to a point where I strongly believe that the people who are being rude/nasty with making ranting, insulting threads here aren't entirely upset with the current gameplay. They just are lazy and/or using the excuse of balance gameplay to vent their soul out. I could care less about what those people do, except I feel sorry for newcomers who have to put up with that amount of negativity and if they're not being careful they might go down that road as well.

I also suspect many people who claim Riot never communicates are the same people who get mad that Riot communicates through Reddit and other platforms too often too. They think that just because it's the LoL forum boards that it's the official place Riot must do all discussions, but Riot i think it pretty good about communicating on their platforms - with these boards just being another platform. Riot actually communicates a lot through these forums compared to their other platforms too, so I don't get the hate.
Yeah, even just seeing the headlines of those threads bums me out and makes me want to play less.

> he mostly comments on what he talked about in the post he made,

Exactly. That isn't a conversation though, that's a speech. There's no back and forth. There's no expanding the developers understanding of the community opinion. There is no attempt to understand whats being complained about. It is this approach to communication that led to them not understanding the problems with dynamic queue for 6 months. They were talking about all the great features without listening to the problems. They reply to the things they want to talk about, instead of what needs to be talked about. They used to have conversations about gameplay on the old forums, really going back and forth with the community, but that doesn't happen anymore. 

They talk about the direction of the game without listening to concerns.

> They dont even check the Dev Corner page. Meddler among others post and respond here quite frequently. Its literally an entire section dedicated to keeping people up to date with potential changes and feedback. Go check it out before saying Riot ignores us.

That isn't communication **with us**, that's communication **at us**. They are telling me what they are doing **not** discussing with about what should be done.

See the difference between an announcement and a conversation?

^

This is my exact issue with the Dev Corner. At the end of the day, the reason most design talk takes place there, rather than on Gameplay, is because the Dev Corner is a designated spot for perfectly packaged announcements that does not need to relate in any way to what the community's been discussing elsewhere. Some devs do respond to the comments, but their responses frequently either repeat what they've already said before, or simply tackle softball questions, while ignoring more serious complaints or giving them complete non-answers. There is no real two-way communication, and the disconnect between the devs and the players is palpable on there.

I think a good example of proper two-way communication was when Jinxylord asked for feedback on the Rengar revert: throughout the entire process, he asked players for ideas and input, which he implemented directly into his changes, and generally took the time to try to understand what it is players wanted out of Rengar, instead of just sharing his thoughts and following his own direction exclusively the entire time. It is because of this healthy communication that the Rengar revert turned out so successful, and it surprises me that more devs do not try to do the same thing in view of this success, especially since so many clunkers have been the direct result of poor communication with players.

You don't get to backpedal into a different argument of "it's too late now". If it was too late, you wouldn't be bitching about this much, even if the problem slowly crept up and has gotten worse after a few seasons.

>We aren't even sure they are doing what we asked them to do at this point.

Riot Axes replied to a thread about the mid season changes. An official Rioter that's likely working on them. You were probably not going to get this information by someone from the skins team. What about the things he mentioned wasn't aligning with what "we" wanted?

People want Marksmen nerfed.
That's fine. But if they are the DPS class, they're likely not going to lose this capability. What would've been the point of a Marksman in a game if they weren't able to do their job properly? This isn't about gutting a class, this is about fixing the issues they have. The issue is too easy (cheap) itemization, too soon damage boost (1.5+ items) and crit getting out of hand, almost competing for burst in terms of Assassins and Mages alike.

What this means?
We'll see on the PBE in the following weeks for the next few patches.

I don't want to be buffed, i just want my play to mean something, right now it doesn't.

Your play does mean something. 

The meta is only _slightly_ worse for solo carrying than it was a couple seasons ago - people just blow it way out of proportion. The fact is that people have claimed that "my team drags me down" from the start of the game in season 1 - so it's not like theyll suddenly _stop_ complaining about it.

Huge misconception: Having a high KDA/CS/Damage does not mean carrying the game. It's what you do with that damage/extra gold that matters. 

You could go 11/0 every game, and then die 3 times in a row at 25 minutes. Guess what? Your score will be 11/3 but you solo lost the game for your team. Or you could be 11/0 and not be grouped (not read the map properly to realize that the enemy team is collapsing on your team) and solo lose the game. 

Look at most Challenger/high elo players, they have bad KDAs - but thats because having a good KDA doesn't indicate you being good, but being good will result in a high KDA.

PS: I wasn't even specifically talking about you, just boards in general.
